title.narrative: Quorum: kvinnor och ungas demokratiska deltagande, NIMD
Quorum: women and youth innovating democracy - NIMD

description.narrative:
The Netherlands Institute for Multiparty Democracy (NIMD) Colombia has applied to Sida for funding of 9 million SEK to carry out the project "Quorum: Women and Youth Innovating Democracy” in Colombia, during the period 2021-2023.
The intervention aims at increasing women and youth equal political participation and influence in decision-making settings as a guarantee for the full exercise of their political rights, by 1) improving the capacities and skills of women and youth from the most conflict-affected territories to participate in political and civic processes and influence decision-making settings of their communities; 2) enhancing the organizational capacities of political actors to guarantee the equal participation of women and youth in decision-making settings; and 3) developing a women and youth lead an evidence-based proposal to improve their political participation and representation under equality parameters.
The intervention’s total budget is 9 million SEK.

The Netherlands Institute for Multiparty Democracy (NIMD, det nederländska institutet för flerpartidemokrati) i Colombia har ansökt om finansiering hos Sida på 9 miljoner kronor för att genomföra projektet ”Quorum: kvinnor och ungas demokratiska deltagande” i Colombia under perioden 2021-2023.
Insatsen syftar till att öka kvinnors och ungdomars lika politiska deltagande och inflytande i beslutsfattande organ för att kunna garantera deras politiska rättigheter genom att 1) i de mest konfliktdrabbade områdena förbättra kvinnors och ungdomars kapacitet och färdigheter till att delta i både politiska och civila processer och för att kunna utöva inflytande i lokalt beslutsfattande; 2) stärka de politiska aktörernas organisatoriska kapacitet för att garantera lika deltagande av kvinnor och ungdomar i beslutsfattande organ; och 3) utveckla ett evidensbaserat förslag lett av kvinnor och ungdomar för att förbättra deras politiska deltagande och representation.
Insatsens totala budget är 9 miljoner kronor.

title.narrative: Signed Decision on Agreement NIMD Quorum Program

description.narrative:
2021 was the first year of implementation of the contribution. Some examples of results achieved are:
- Three Democracy Schools (DS) were implemented in prioritized departments (Caqueta, Cauca, and Tolima) with participation of 169 persons, including 105 women and 64 young men, 6 LGBTIQ people and 17 indigenous people. Through five modules of the DS, participants improved their capacities to participate in democratic mechanisms by 65% as compared with the initial measurement. The last module and graduation of the DS were carried out in February 2022.
- Training on how to conduct successful electoral campaigns for Municipal Youth Councils were conducted with participation of 197 people (104 women and 90 young men) in prioritized departments and the national level. These trainings contributed to strengthen capacities of candidates to the firs-time election of the Municipal Youth Councils, held on December 5th, 2021.
- NIMD facilitated multiparty dialogue at the national level and in prioritized departments to discuss strategies to increase women and young peoples' political participation. 133 people (62 women and 70 men) attended these multiparty dialogues during 2021.
- As an unexpected result, in the context of the national strike, which was largely based on young peoples demands, NIMD developed a methodology to facilitate dialogue between municipal governments and citizens called Citizen Panels for Deliberation in Times of Crisis. This methodology was created at the request of a political party, but its training involved 66 local public servants coming from different political backgrounds, including 14 people from the projects prioritized departments.
Moreover, as part of NIMDs organizational strengthening strategy following BDOs Internal Control Review recommendations, three partnerships were established with expert organizations on protection measures (Protection International), transparency policies (Transparencia por Colombia) and monitoring and evaluation (NIMD Headquarters in The Hague). Progress in the three areas have been made, including two workshops for NIMDs staff on protection and risks assessment, updating the organizations protection plan and response protocol, an integrity climate study of the organization, and the formulation of the projects baseline.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
